item.title: When food is family
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Like everyone else in the world, the spread of the COVID- 19 pandemic spoiled a lot of plans for chef Akanksha Dean. She was all set to go to Spain to begin a Masters in culinary arts and hotel management when COVID-19 began to spread around the planet. That being said though, Akanksha already has an…
item.content:encoded:
Like everyone else in the world, the spread of the COVID- 19 pandemic spoiled a lot of plans for chef Akanksha Dean. She was all set to go to Spain to begin a Masters in culinary arts and hotel management when COVID-19 began to spread around the planet. That being said though, Akanksha already has an enviable pedigree in all things dining related.

The daughter of celebrated chef Bakshish Dean and lifestyle columnist and photographer Rupali Dean, in 2017, Akanksha beame the first Indian to train at Osteria Francescana, a three-Michelin-star restaurant based in Modena, Italy, which is considered one of the best restaurants in the world.

item.title: Coronavirus Live Updates: U.S. Daily Cases and Hospitalizations Near Record
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Friday was the fourth day running that the United States reported over 1,100 deaths. Spain is facing renewed travel restrictions imposed by fellow European countries. RIGHT NOW The first hurricane of the Atlantic season is bearing down on an area around Corpus Christi, Texas, that is already struggling to contain a surge in virus cases.
item.content:encoded:
Friday was the fourth day running that the United States reported over 1,100 deaths. Spain is facing renewed travel restrictions imposed by fellow European countries.

RIGHT NOW

The first hurricane of the Atlantic season is bearing down on an area around Corpus Christi, Texas, that is already struggling to contain a surge in virus cases.
